Review Title: Massively over rated and over priced.
Review Text: The restaurant is elegant and the service was suoperb.   The food was over complicated and virtually every dish was swimming in butter, or cream or both.  Every dish has some form of dairy - cream, cheese or butter.  The key ingredients were often buried by over complex and elaborate side ingredients that dominated the flavors.   Also, the price was $520 and not anywhere close to $350.    Would NOT recommend or return

Review Title: Out of this world!
Review Text: OH MY WORD, what an experience. We have been lucky enough to eat in some of the best restaurants in Europe and beyond and I have to say this really tops the list. There are no words for me to say that will do this place justice. We had the most incredible food and the service was absolutely second to non. We always expect a certain level when we visit Michelin star accredited establishments, but this went beyond. The staff were so attentive but at the same time you didnt know they were there. Everything was so discreet. What a superb team of people and the best best food, so worthy of its two stars. We will be flying back to Copenhagen again in the near future just to visit Kadeau. If you havent been then get it on your list immediately!!

Review Title: Amazing mostly - too expensive …
Review Text:
This is an incredible place where they put heart and soul into what they are doing.   I do recommend you going but have to warn on price  hence 4 stars - I spent £1300 on a meal for two with one middling bottle of wine and a shared flight of (amazing) fruit juices.   That is too much.    For that the food and atmosphere have to completely blow you away and that didn’t quite happen.

All of the menu is inspired by an Island between Sweden and Denmark which - best will in the world - restricts variety of ingredients although they are valiant with what they had.   The meal was amazing with much time and care obvious - stand out - walnut tart - but struggle with another big winner of the 14 courses.   Juice flight was stunning work - brilliant and I was mightily impressed and inspired by that - 

Each course had an explanation - whole thing spookily like the film “the menu” If you’ve seen it!    

Was I glad I went - yes very nearly.   The price feels wrong by about 20/30%.  But you can see where the cost comes from.   You can see I have mixed feelings as it’s a huge effort of will and creativity.   Restaurant was full too and all seemed happy - 

If you can afford reasonably easily - go.   If it’s a one off and you want your socks blown off - then it’s a maybe.

Review Title: Innovation and perfection
Review Text: It is very hard to describe this restaurant appropriately since the sensorial experience is just unexpected and amazing. The restaurant offers a fixed menu with 14 different servings, wine, or juice pairings (don't miss the incredible juice pairing). Dietary needs are considered (you have to tell them in advance). There are only eight tables; the kitchen is open-sight, and the chefs themselves serve the menu and explain ingredients and preparation. The style is minimalistic, with the accent on fish, vegetables, and preserves, most of them coming from the island of Bornholm. The service is impeccable, and the ambiance is friendly and elegant. A restaurant not to miss.

Review Title: Much better than how I expected for
Review Text: The first four dish which is made of by smoked skill and it is from the small island such as Bornholm after that the last one is the winter iconic dish

Review Title: Wonderful example of what makes the new nordic cuisine so exciting
Review Text: Incredible service and a lot of interesting new flavours through the various preserving techniques that they apply. Broad wine list with knowledgeable sommeliers.

Review Title: Mind-blowing food served by a humble team in an ex-hot yoga studio
Review Text: We ate at a lot of good places in Copenhagen and Kadeau was our favorite meal. It was mind-blowing. The food was well presented and so unique - flavors we wouldn't have just anywhere. The space and team were so warm and friendly - the waiters were very chatty and made us feel welcome. Some nice restaurants are pretentious, but Kadeau was humble and inclusive. Good cocktails (we event went to Ruby bar the next day) and wine pairing. Highly recommend.

Review Title: Copenhagen GOAT
Review Text: Absolutely wonderful on every level.  GOAT status.  Gorgeous, cozy and creative.  Attentive and friendly staff add depth and expertise.

Review Title: The absolute best we had in Copenhagen
Review Text:
If you want to have one of the best meals of your life, you should come here.

If not, I don't know what else to tell you. Nor do I have the vocabulary to tell you how good the food was, or the extreme hygge we were enthralled by at the end of the night. I would actually get the juice pairing over the wine to get an additional suite of tastes that you haven't had before.

So glad we had this on our last night in town. It was such a perfect ending to our visit.

Review Title: A most memorable meal in an exquisite setting...
Review Text: What a little gem: small and intimate, elegant in every detail - from the dark and woody interior to the masterful light that made the patrons and the food the focus of attention, to the inviting inner courtyard with plants, flowers and herbs (some of which during the evening ended up on our plates), to the incredibly knowledgable and caring staff, to the super friendly chefs that did not skip a beat at the kitchen. Every bite was a delightful explosion of flavors, probably with the exception of one - pork - which was delicious yet a little heavy for me (mostly because I am less of a carnivore than I thought I was). Worth repeats and definitely worth a visit, especially if you are looking for a smaller, not-pretentious-yet-exquisite fine dining location in Copenhagen

Review Title: Great food by a great team
Review Text:
Let me start with the lovely staff: Nothing like having the chef greet you and welcome you when you walk in. The team was amazing and attentive and there when needed, but otherwise not hovering. Everyone was friendly and it was a pleasure seeing how the kitchen staff worked on the dishes. 

Except for the prawns which were a little too rich for me, all dishes were amazing -- especially the peas wrapped in fig leaves which reminded me of a Peruvian childhood dish. The smoked salmon was to die for, so was the hake. Desserts were delicious, too. 

The vibe was not pretentious or stiff at all, which made the evening even more fun. Definitely worth 2 Michelin stars!

Review Title: “Simply The Best”
Review Text: From start to finish our visit was flawless. The staff, the ambiance and of course the food, all were quite simply as good as it gets. Every dish was beautifully presented by knowledgeable chefs, their care and enthusiasm for what they had created was infectious and elevated their creations to a level I have not previously experienced. The wine pairing was presented expertly and knowledgeably and perfectly complimented each and every dish. It would seem unfair to single out individual dishes as each course was stunning but the hot and cold smoked salmon with onion and lavender was salmon on a whole new level. As for the Queen scallop ice cream what genius not only conjures that one up but executes it to perfection! Do not miss the opportunity to eat at this restaurant, we traveled from Wales simply for this reason and it was well worth the effort.

Review Title: Deserving of their stars, unique and special dining experience
Review Text: The quality and preparation of the food along with the warm and friendly service made this a truly special dining experience. Menu was varied and creative and the meal was well paced with interesting wine pairings selected. Best salmon I have ever had, hands down! The atmosphere is refined but not stuffy.

Review Title: Excellent in all ways
Review Text: This is a quiet, small restaurant.  Staff are friendly and warm while still entirely professional.  The food is among the best I've ever eaten, focusing primarily on seafood and locally sourced ingredients.  Unfamiliar ingredients are used creatively but not in a gimmicky way -- they are always blended harmoniously and contribute greatly.

Review Title: One of the best Restaurants in København.
Review Text: Hidden behind a nondescript door is one of the best kept secrets of the culinary scene in Europe — Kadeau. Where every dish is a culinary masterpiece and an objet d’art in the skilled hands of its many passionate sous-chefs under the direction of its chef. A soft spoken man with an eye for detail. This establishment is a 2 star Michelin deserving the third. It is understated maintaining an air of hospitality than arrogance away from the normal attitude of restaurants at its level. Attire is INFORMAL which bodes nicely and removes all pretence from its guests and staff. Every member of the staff is conversant on the particulars of each dish. This epitomises their passion for their craft and not some burnt out staff waiting to collect a paycheque with an air of arrogance that one sees and expects from restaurants of this calibre. If in Copenhagen then this is a must visit.

Review Title: Top class diner
Review Text:
Amazing finesse and beautifully presented food. Extreme quality of the products.
Hosts are elegant without being distant. Every course was a beauty to watch and a heaven in the mouth. We did take a nice bottle of wine on the exhaustive winelist (with help of a charming sommelier); the proposed wine pairing is prohibitively expensive at 240euro/person.

Review Title: Excellent
Review Text:
While I thought the food was sensational my guest couldn’t eat fish or shellfish and I had pre warned the restaurant in advance that my guest was not a vegetarian and couldn’t eat fish but could eat all meats. A little disappointing that the none fish option was either vegetables or they just couldn’t bother making the effort, enclosed a photo of the caviar dish served for two.

Other than not catering for none fish eaters everything else was delicious and exquisite, the sea urchins dish was superb as was the prawn and caviar. The wild duck had a wonderful gamy flavour. Outstanding flavours throughout. Unfortunately we found the juice flight very disappointing, would of like more herbal  flavours rather than sweet fruit flavours

Review Title: Truly outstanding
Review Text: Every dish beautifully presented, clean, fresh and surprising. Copenhagen is deserving a food capital nomination at par with Tokyo and San Sebastian. This is a Nordic version of a Japanese Kaiseki dinner. Service couldn’t be friendlier. Noma, Geranium, Kadeau and so many more what happened to the porc, herring and potatoes country ?

Review Title: Flavor combinations made my tastebuds soar
Review Text: The inventive dishes had us marveling at each serving, and by the end I wished we had appetite for more. So rarely have I had a tasting menu where every dish was a joy to eat. Each plating was served at the table by a different chef; it was a wonderful and personable way to get to meet all the kitchen staff. Rasmus curated our drinking experience with warmth and great humor, and Daniel kept an eye on our table so we never wanted for anything. This was an evening I will remember for a long, long time.

Review Title: Simply exquisite and worthy of a trip to Copenhagen
Review Text: Simply exquisite night out to celebrate an occasion, just being in Copenhagen, or the art of food.  Service is flawless and the definition of gracious without being haughty in the slightest.  The dishes are food as art, and the ingredients are the epitome and essence of themselves if that makes sense.  As fine as dining gets and distinctions in this ethereal realm between 2 and 3 star Michelin eateries are hard to discern.  The only tiny critique: the non-alcohol drink pairings were a little one-not and on the sweet-tangy side.  A couple had the main fruit juice component overwhelm the other flavors.  A bit more variation with tonics, bitters, kombuchas and the like would elevate the “flight.”

Review Title: Best Meal We Have Had For Years
Review Text:
A great dining experience, all dishes were well thought through, produce mainly sourced locally, and despite being a 18 course taster menu, then one leaves the restaurant feeling just perfect, as it was exactly the right amount of food.

Best meal we had for years, and truly a 2 Michelin Star experience, which can not be said about all Michelin Star restaurants...

Great service and knowledgeable staff going out of their way to answer our many questions, highly recommendable!

Review Title: Original, natural, unique
Review Text:
The backbone of their cuisine is the nature of Bornholm – the wild as well as the cultivated. The cuisine is regional, yet they are inspired by the whole world. 
They cultivate their own herbs, vegetables, fruits, and berries, and the result of these dishes that are coming from a Danish Island located in the Baltic Sea in the south of Sweden is surprising.
It’s not cheap but it’s worth trying it... 
The team is super nice, the service impeccable and the location hidden.

We loved it.

Review Title: We came here after dining
Review Text: We came here after dining at Noma and received a list of Copenhagen highlights from Redzepi, this included. It came as a great choice, creative , well designed food, tasty. Perfect

Review Title: Blast of a night! Purest form of design everywhere!
Review Text: What an extraordinary night, the stunning restaurant is just the start. We did not expect to experience this level of quality in service and food in a two star restaurant. All dishes are designed with so much precision. Service is not too stiff which for us completely made the night! It was great to speak to all the nationalities that contributed our night! Staff is young and ambitious! Would love to come back one day!

Review Title: An Amazing Culinary Experience in Copenhagen
Review Text:
A truly unique culinary experience. This was an 18 course, four hour extravaganza that is a real splurge but well worth it for the experience. The staff was truly amazing. It was not the typical stuffy 2 star  Michelin restaurant. It was real fun as the staff freely interacted with the guests in conversation about their backgrounds, the food and anything else you might like to engage them with. The chef graciously showed us how some of the dishes were prepared. The food was truly amazing Danish modern. Many of the ingredients were organic from their farm in Bornholm, where they also foraged for some of the more unusual ingredients. 
though it currently does not have the cache of Noma, it is on par with it .It truly is an experience not to be missed if it is in your budget and culinary liking. Though it is stirictly a prix fixe they are more than willing to accomodate your likes and dislikes and any reasonable dietary restrictions. Just let them know when you make the reservation.
